greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Row n of table represents second signature of A013929(n): list of exponents >= 2 in canonical prime factorization of A013929(n), in nonincreasing order.
comment: Length of row n equals A212177(n).
reference: M. Abramowitz and I. A. Stegun, eds., Handbook of Mathematical Functions, National Bureau of Standards Applied Math. Series 55, 1964 (and various reprintings), p. 844.
link: Jason Kimberley, Table of i, a(i) for i = 1..4492 (n = 1..3917)
M. Abramowitz and I. A. Stegun, eds., Handbook of Mathematical Functions, National Bureau of Standards, Applied Math. Series 55, Tenth Printing, 1972 [alternative scanned copy].
Primefan, The First 2500 Integers Factored (1st of 5 pages)
formula: This sequence is both the subsequence of A212171 formed by omitting all 1s and the subsequence of A212172 formed by omitting all 0's. - _Jason Kimberley_, Jun 13 2012
example: 12 = 2^2*3 has positive exponents 2 and 1 in its prime factorization, but only exponents that are 2 or greater appear in a number's second signature. Hence, 12's second signature is {2}. Since 12 = A013929(4), row 4 of the table represents the second signature {2}.
results.author: _Matthew Vandermast_, Jun 03 2012
